partArray.text: Poverty of experience. This should not be understood to mean people are yearning for new experience. No, they long to free themselves from experience; they long for a world in which they can make such pure and decided use of their poverty their outer poverty, and ultimately also their inner poverty that it will lead to something respectable. Nor are they ignorant or inexperienced. Often we could say the very opposite. They have devoured everything, both culture and people, and they have had such a surfeit that it has exhausted them.
